body:
Hi,
if I start neovim in the terminal app and then switch to full screen, neovim doesn't resize correctly. It takes the whole width but not the full height available! 
If syntax highlighting is disabled (syntax off) neovim resizes correctly.
### To reproduce:
- Start nvim in terminal app `nvim .vimrc -u NONE`
- Switch terminal app to fullscreen -> nvim resized correctly (takes full height and width)
- Disable fullscreen
- Switch syntax highlighting on `:syntax on`
- Switch terminal app to fullscreen -> neovim resized incorrectly (takes full width, not full heigh)

This problem doesn't affect vim, but affects neovim both in Terminal app and iTerm2.

comment_data.body:
I can confirm this issue (using the "awesome" window manager), and maximizing the terminal.

It does not appear to affect fullscreen mode, and can be more easily triggered with e.g. Neovim's src/nvim/terminal.c than with the startify buffer after starting nvim.
It's not 100% reproducible for me though, but will eventually happen sometimes.

A workaround appears to be then to first maximize the terminal window vertically and then horizontally.
Yeah, it also happens when resizing the window manually, but it's not always reproducible. Instead using the osx fullscreen feature I can reproduce it constantly :(

It sounds like `SIGWINCH` is not handled properly.

From a quick look, this seems to help for me:

```
diff --git i/src/nvim/tui/tui.c w/src/nvim/tui/tui.c
index 72f9397..14369e8 100644
--- i/src/nvim/tui/tui.c
+++ w/src/nvim/tui/tui.c
@@ -210,7 +210,7 @@ static void sigwinch_cb(uv_signal_t *handle, int signum)
   event_push((Event) {
     .data = handle->data,
     .handler = try_resize
-  }, false);
+  }, true);
 }

 static bool attrs_differ(HlAttrs a1, HlAttrs a2)
```

It changes the `deferred` attribute of the queued event to `true`.

Maybe the issue is that otherwise the event gets handled too early sometimes,
while the window has been resized only horizontally?!
I just tried your simple patch and indeed it solves the problem for me.
it  was working better for a second, but now (Commit: 94153ab975401572ea6942b4fba8dcfba53ceecc) the bug is back..
I have this problem on ubuntu with gnome-terminal and st. Also reported with xterm. Renamed the issue because it's not OSX-specific.

Still doesn't work for me.
No it's buggy for me too.. commit b6af1afee6eab0a430533efcbb8af6c6b1ffe585 OSX 10.10.3 (14D136) Terminal Version 2.5.3 (343.7)
Just wondering, is there are reason why the fix proposed by @blueyed can't be applied? It completely fixes the bug for me
This problem is back now
Right, because it should be changed to `async=false`. I had my eye on that.

@tarruda If I follow 502aee690c980fcb3cfcb3f211dcfad06103db46 correctly, it looks like `tui_start()` is adding `sigwinch_cb` to the "fast events" queue, which is not deferred to the main loop. But the fix for this issue (https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/2738) suggests that `sigwinch_cb` should be deferred. How can this be achieved now?
That solves it! @tarruda
Is anybody else seeing a regression on master for this?  (I've filed https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/3385 about it)
I still face this issue in `terminator`. Pressing `f11` after maximizing the terminator solved the issue for me.
